programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc:
The Haute-Loire, from Puy-en-Velay to the meandering Allier Gorge
A journey through the unspoilt region of the Auvergne volcanoes, where the beauty of the landscape is only equalled by the generosity of the locals. From Puy-en-Velay to Mont Mézenc, Chaise-Dieu to the villages of Blesles and Chilhac, an unmissable adventure for all who love good food and untamed nature.
Directed by: Florent Quet (season 7, France, 2020)

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 1:

An in-depth look at the secrets of the French luxury industry, and earrings for men. The Marseilles collective Laissez Passer recycles below-standard and abandoned harbour materials. How to wear satin, whatever the occasion. The association Fleurs d'Halage offers a second life to polluted areas of Paris.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Flora Mikula
One of the few women to have forged a career in a male-dominated world, the chef Flora Mikula settled in the Camargue. She guides us from Nîmes to the boundaries of the Rhône delta, on foot, on horseback, by car... for wonderful food, cheery banter and general love of life.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life in harmony with nature Carole-Lyne Robin has transformed her life by building an off-grid tiny house. Between working as a volunteer with the reindeer and her job as a wildlife ranger, Carole-Lyne lives in harmony with her environment. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: Programme summary: - Behind the scenes at the Unesco building - Encounter with Pierre Bonnefille, designer and Maître d'Art - Paris, in the footsteps of Honoré de Balzac - Encounter with Delphine Lescuyer, mosaicist Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc:
Alpes de Haute-Provence, from Ubaye to Giono's Provence
The Alpes de Haute-Provence, a department that perfectly combines lakes of turquoise water and sheer sandstone cliffs. In the high mountains of Ubaye, Barcelonnette seems to have arrived directly from Mexico. In the Pays de Banon, so beloved of Jean Giono, we visit Simiane-la-Rotonde and Valsaintes Abbey.
Directed by: Mélodie Proust (season 7, France, 2020)

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 2:

Spotlight on bread by the Poilâne family. The swimsuit: a story studded with scandal. In his Parisian workshop at the Viaduc des Arts, Philippe Atienza reveals the craft of the boot-maker to the public gaze. How to wear a long necklace. The portrait of eyewear manufacturer Amaury Cagniard, master craftsman.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc:
Gilles Tournadre
The chef Gilles Tournadre welcomes us to his home city of Rouen, the only French city to have joined the Unesco Creative Cities Network. With a love of Japanese culture and cuisine, the Normandy chef reveals some of the culinary secrets of his region.
Presented by: Emmanuelle Delteil.

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: Life in harmony with nature Carole-Lyne Robin has transformed her life by building an off-grid tiny house. Between working as a volunteer with the reindeer and her job as a wildlife ranger, Carole-Lyne lives in harmony with her environment. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.desc: Programme summary: - Behind the scenes at the Gobelins manufactory - Encounter with Hélène Timsit at the head of the Mazarine fashion house - Exploring New York - Encounter with the glass designer Bernard Pictet Presented by: Katherina Marx.

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Chicken soup and macaroni
Ricardo presents two recipes that are quick and easy to prepare: Tex-Mex style beef macaroni, and chicken soup with konjac noodles.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Choux de Bruxelles en salade et en soupe
programme.desc: Brussels sprouts as a salad and a soup Émilie Rizzetto cooks Brussels sprouts two different ways: in a soup with leeks and vegan bacon, and in a crunchy salad with hazelnuts. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Le grand move
programme.desc: Isabelle and Jaime, Gaspé Peninsula Isabelle and Jaime lived in Montreal with their children. One day, returning from a stay on the Gaspé Peninsula, Jaime suggested they settle there permanently. Directed by: Mariloup Wolfe (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: The Tales of Hoffmann After "Carmen" it is one of the most frequently-performed French operas in the world. "The Tales of Hoffmann", Jacques Offenbach's ultimate work, to a libretto by Jules Barbier, was created posthumously in February 1881. Robert Carsen was responsible for staging it in 2000. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Mount Albert, Ontario
At a client's house, Louis has his work cut out extracting young raccoons from behind her bedroom walls. In Kitchener, Louis handles a nest of chicks.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Nordic food Three guests born in Scandinavia come together to cook dishes from their respective regions: Sweden, Norway and Denmark. Mahée Paiement joins the gang to relive her travel memories! Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: #Versionfrançaise
programme.desc: The secret behind-the-scenes world of the mediaeval Château de Roquetaillade. Discovering the chic eco-friendly universe of Marie-France de Crécy, textile designer and artist, who brings poetry to recycling. A journey in the footsteps of Coluche. Cards, notebooks, posters, bookmarks, invitations... In Paris, Letterpress uses all the expertise of old-fashioned printing. Presented by: Katherina Marx.
